['Unlike standard credit purchases, under a hire-purchase agreement:', 'The buyer does not own the item until all the agreed payments have been made (in contrast to a lease or rental).', 'Ownership remains with the seller until final payment is completed; during this period, the buyer has possession of and can use the goods.', "There's typically an option for the buyer at any point before completing all payments to purchase outright by making a balloon payment (lump-sum) or renegotiating terms with the seller.", 'If the buyer fails to meet their obligations, the goods can be repossessed without needing to prove that loss has occurred since ownership is not transferred until full payments have been completed.', 'The agreement usually includes a clause specifying that interest may or will accrune from missed payments and additional charges (e.g., storage fees for seized items) may apply.', 'Hire-purchase agreements often include comprehensive insurance coverage to protect the value of the goods, which is paid by the buyer through installments.', "It's a commonly used method in auto financing but can be applied to any tangible asset with resale value.", 'The agreement may require an initial deposit and establishes regular payment intervals until full ownership is transferred.', 'This type of contract often has fixed interest rates, unlike traditional loans where the market influences fluctuating rates.', "If all payments are completed as per the agreement's terms, any outstanding balance including principal sum and accrued interest becomes void."]
